title: If the speed of light is 670,616,629 mph, what is the speed of the absence of “darkness”? Is it minutely faster? - Quora

response.answer_text: The speed of light is nothing else than the maximum speed reachable by an object which must have zero rest mass to reach it. By coincidence, photons have zero rest mass, so they can travel at that speed. What you call “absence of darkness” depends on your senses. Your eyes are hit by a photon and a cell has a receptor that transforms it into an electric signal that reach your barin and is interpretated, so the speed of “absence of darkness” is much slower.
